column4: I try to mount my external HD but I get this error message hal-storage-removable-mount-all-options refused uid 1000, It works fine in gnome
That seems to be a bug in kde/kubuntu. The work arond is just to mount it from the command line
how should I mount it and send it to automount? I'm a novice in these things :D
You can't automount. You will have to manually mount. Is that ok?
well I think I'll manage
byw how?
but*
ok. do: "sudo mount /dev/sdb1 /mnt" ...
Where sdb1 is your device and /mnt is the mount point.
ok, thanks
It is NTFS, right?
yes
so should I type media/myHD
does /media/myHD exist?
it's the place where my hd is
it's the place where my hd is
I mean I don't need to type that dev1?
The mount point must exist before you can mount anything there. e.g. "sudo mkdir /media/myHD"
ok
Yes. you need to tell what device you want to mount and where you want to mount it.
To un-mount do "umount /mnt" or if you mounted to /media/myHD do "umount /media/myHD"
* sudo
Sorry "sudo umount /media/myHD"
I get "mount: special device media/elements does not exist"
